channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Bicycle Lane paving material not safe in cold icy conditions, 5th December
item.description:
The newer bike lanes at this junction have various different surface materials. One of the surface materials that has been used is completely inappropriate and unsafe in frosty/icy conditions. Under these conditions it becomes incredibly slippery, almost ice rink like, and results in many cyclists falling off their bikes. The surfaces need to be reconsidered and replaced with something far safer and more suitable to the large numbers of bikes that use this area, especially many parents with children on their bikes. On 05/12/2025 this was a serious problem and no salt or grit had been spread by the council either. Myself and another cyclist, along with a caretaker from the nearby school had to cover the entire area ourselves to prevent further injury, after 10s of cyclists had fallen. Please address this urgently.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Court Lane, Dulwich Village, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Completely blocked and covered gulley drain outside 65 Southend Crescent, 5th December
item.description:
We have just moved in so don’t know how long this has been a problem. This is outside our house - blocked drain and completely covered meaning water cannot enter and instead is draining down the hill and running into the path and into our driveway towards the house causing water damage.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Footscray Road, Eltham

item.title: Ned for months / years and need to be removed urgently., 5th December
item.description:
The silver & red cars are on east side of Lulworth road between Crewys and Wroxton. The black VW Sharan is in front of 1 Wroxton Roadaround the corner from Lulworth. They have blocked off parking and electric charging facility for other road users and residents for literally years. A met police officer said that these cars have been abandoned there by car repair outfits near by and one or two of them do not have owners. The two, red and silver, are not taxed and do not have MOT certificates. They should not be on the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wroxton Road, Nunhead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
